div.head: TO THE VERTVOVS AND WORTHIE KNIGHT SIR IOHN BOYS of Canterburie, my very good Vncle, Grace and peace.
div.p:
SIR, you did first plant my studies, Archbishop VVhitegift that president of pietie, watered them, and God gaue increase: to God, as to the fountaine of all goodnesse, I consecrate all that I haue: to your happy memories, as to the conduits of much good, I dedicate this ensuing Postill, especially to your selfe suruiuing, as to my best Patron in Cambridge, where the foundation of this worke was laid; vnto your selfe, as to the chiefe procurer of that small Benefice, where the frame was raised; vnto your selfe, as to
the liuely paterne of that doctrine, which is here deliuered.

Accept it as your owne; for it beares your name; and resembling you much, endeuors to honour you long: so you shall encourage me daily to lessen my debt to the Church, and increase mine obligations vnto your selfe, that liuing and dying I may continue

closer.signed: Your most bounden Nephew, Iohn Boys.
